After 20 years of using FIREFOX I'm about to split for another browser. This is turning into a bad experience. Not happy.
creator: pcat1121

title: 100% disk usage, SEVEN instances of Firefox open in Task Manager?
content:
Hi Forum Folke,

I'm troubleshooting a "100% disk usage" problem in my wife's laptop. Not the first time, either. Every time I get it squared away (different problem each time), it runs well for a couple of weeks, then it's back again and SOOOO slow it's nearly unuseable. It's a new (less than one year old) Dell laptop running the latest version of Win10, and it's fully updated.

I click on the Firefox icon in the taskbar to open it, and after a couple of minutes get a blank white rectangle, and several minutes later, it's still a blank white rectangle. Fired up Task Manager, and yup... back to 100% disk usage, this time with Firefox sitting right at #1 on the disk usage hog list. It shows Firefox once, but with a down carat. Click on the carat, and it shows SEVEN instances of Firefox running! I have only one Firefox window open, and only a single tab open within that window... so why am I looking at anywhere from six to nine instances of Firefox running? (Happens to be seven right now...)

Usually it's "System" that's sitting up there, or any one or group of Windows system processes that's pulling everything down, but not this time. Haven't seen this one before.

Hope somebody has some ideas; this is a battle I'm getting *really* tired of fighting; it's a lot like playing "whack-a-mole," only not nearly as much fun. Microsoft has no definitive fix (of course...), just a long laundry list of things to try. ALL of 'em seem to work for some people, but not for others. And if you DO manage to kill it... it always seems to come back after awhile. Linux is looking better every day, gotta tell ya!

Thanks in advance!!
creator: kharrisma

title: lose data
content:
This is a response from one of your technicians (((( its possible that you were not syncing, though you thought you were doing so. its also possible that maybe you sync'd to a different FF account. but who knows. try a test: create a new profile. and once invoke, dont do nothing except a sync. sometimes it can take up to 5 minutes to download. but there should be a spinning wheel to show that syncing is currently be done. go to url and find / use create button: ))))))

This is my response 0...

Dear, I am a computer maintenance engineer Not the first time I did a factory reset of my computer It is not the first time that I synchronize my data with Firefox But this time I do not know what happened with you, I lost all my data Secret numbers, account numbers and all saved cookies I think I will change the browser to another browser I can no longer trust your synchronization settings And I am not satisfied with this service

title: Playing video in Chordify app does not work allways, in Google Chrome there's no such problem

Hello everybody,

I use the music program Chordify to practice harmonica songs. Great program, because you can make all kind of loops, change tempo etc. etc. And, almost every song that's on YT you can Chordify, meaning that the program gives you the guitar chords. It's good, it's great and very affordable.

But there's a problem when i'm using Firefox and go to Chordify. Some YT clips are not chordified, the program says the YT clip has been moved ore enabled to function with chordify. Then i go to Google chrome, start up Chordify from there and there's no such problem...

Can anyone give me advice how to solve this? My preferred browser is Firefox. Thanks a lot!

Matt

title: iCloud Bookmarks reappearing after deleted
content:
I know this is a question that's been asked to death but I cannot for the life of me figure out what is going on and none of the existing posted solutions have worked for me. I have a certain set of bookmarks that keep reappearing, sometimes 4-5 times in the same folder no matter how many times I have deleted them. Things I've tried:

  • Bulleted list itemDisabling Firefox Sync and just using iCloud bookmarks
  • Bulleted listDeleting favicons.sqlite and places.sqlite
  • Bulleted listClearing startup cache
  • Bulleted listVerify integrity which told me:

Task: invalidateCaches The caches have been invalidated

  • Bulleted listRefresh Firefox in about:support

They re-appear almost instantly and seem to create another instance of all affected bookmarks whenever icloud/firefox sync.

Any help would be greatly appreciated

title: On M1 Mac Mini, leaving Firefox running for extended amounts of time causes Firefox to hang and MacOS networking to break
content:
Hey there...Mozillians? Hopefully that's the right word here.

Just wanted to pass along this issue to get it on your radar. I have an M1 Mac mini and I've noticed a peculiar bug that seems to be a combination of a bug in Firefox and a bug in MacOS. Let's say I fire up my Mac, browse the internet for a while and step away for the night (and computer doesn't go to sleep...disabled that - anyway).

I come back to my computer a while later, maybe 6-10 hours or so. When I come back, Firefox seems to be completely hung up and wifi is completely broken on MacOS. I cannot load any pages, and while I can close Firefox windows the application itself will not actually close until I use the MacOS force close menu. No applications at this point can access network resources until the Mac is rebooted, which cannot happen until Firefox is force closed, like described earlier.

Anyway, if there is any info you need, feel free to let me know and I'll try to get it for you. Happy to help wherever I can.
